org.TheGivingChild.Screens

Class ScreenMaze

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
      • org.TheGivingChild.Screens.ScreenMaze
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor, com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class ScreenMaze
extends com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
implements com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
    Maze screen that the user will navigate around. Player will be able to trigger a miniGame by finding a child in the maze.
    Author:
    mtzimour

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenMaze

        public ScreenMaze()
        Creates a new maze screen and draws the players sprite on it. Sets up map properties such as dimensions and collision areas
        Parameters:
        mazeFile - The name of the maze file in the assets folder
        spriteFile - The name of the sprite texture file in the assets folder

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Draws the maze on the screen with a red background Determines if the sprite is making a valid move within the bounds of the maze and not on a collision, if so allow it to move. If the player triggers a miniGame set that to the current screen.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        render in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

      • keyDown

        public boolean keyDown(int keycode)

      • touchDown

        public boolean touchDown(int screenX,
                         int screenY,
                         int pointer,
                         int button)
        Gets where a user first touched down on their device and saves its position as a vector.
        Specified by:
        touchDown in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Parameters:
        screenX - x coordinate of users down touch
        screenY - y coordinate of users down touch
        pointer - not used
        button - not used

      • touchUp

        public boolean touchUp(int screenX,
                       int screenY,
                       int pointer,
                       int button)
        Gets where a user touches up from their device and saves its position as a vector. Uses the touch up and the previous recorded touch to determine what direction the swipe was in and sets the players movement to the corresponding direction.
        Specified by:
        touchUp in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Parameters:
        screenX - x coordinate of users up touch
        screenY - y coordinate of users up touch
        pointer - not used
        button - not used

      • show

        public void show()
        Sets the maze to be shown, makes sure the player is not moving initially. Sets all layers of the maze to visible. Sets input processor to the maze to begin getting user input for navigation.
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        show in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Hides the maze by setting all layers to not visible. Sets input processor back to the stage.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        hide in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
